intro: Ctenium ledermannii, commonly known as the desert ctenium, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its structure includes a slender, branching stem and small, aromatic leaves that help reduce water loss. Ctenium ledermannii plays a minor role in local ecosystems, providing food for certain insects and small animals.
